com.day.durbo

Class DurboOutput

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.day.durbo.DurboOutput
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DurboConstants

    public class DurboOutput
extends java.lang.Object
implements DurboConstants
    The DurboOutput class provides base implementation for the Durbo serialization. The Durbo is hierarchical name-value pair serialization that is optimized for stream based operation. the basic principal is, that every data element is stored using RLE encoding, i.e. consists of the size of the data, followed by the data itself. on the logical level, those elements can be properties or nodes. the properties consist of zero, one or more values, which are either strings or binaries. the properties itself also hold a high-level property type, namely the PropertyTypes from jsr170. the additional (invisible) element 'namespace' is used to sequentially define namespaces that will be used in the subsequent elements.

    since version 2.1 the deflater of the output stream is reset about every 2^12 bytes (1mb). this generates a output stream that consists of several compressed chunks. this means that a possible reader must be prepared for resetting it's inflater as well. see ChunkedDeflaterOutputStream and ChunkedInflaterInputStream for details. this has only an advantage during deserialization when large binary properties are kept in DurboValues and needed to be read from the consumer.

    Version 2.0 introduced:

    • JCR property type support
    • namespace support
    • zip compression

    Version 2.1 introduced:

    • chunked zip compression

    durbo:= header {elem}; header:= hdrVersion hdrContentType hdrEncoding; hdrVersion := svProp; // with name <a href="../../../com/day/durbo/DurboConstants.html#PROTOCOL_HEADER"><code>DurboConstants.PROTOCOL_HEADER</code></a> hdrContentType := svProp; // with name <a href="../../../com/day/durbo/DurboConstants.html#PROTOCOL_CONTENT_TYPE"><code>DurboConstants.PROTOCOL_CONTENT_TYPE</code></a> hdrEncoding := svProp; // with name <a href="../../../com/day/durbo/DurboConstants.html#PROTOCOL_ENCODING"><code>DurboConstants.PROTOCOL_ENCODING</code></a> <p/> elem:= node | prop | namespace; node:= NODE_START name elemlist NODE_END; prop:= svProp | mvProp; svProp:= PROPERTY|type name value; mvProp:= PROPERTY|MULTIPLE|type name <# values> {value}; namespace:= NAMESPACE prefix uri; prefix:= sValue; uri := sValue; name:= sValue; value:= sValue | bValue; <p/> sValue:= <size of string.getBytes()> <string.getBytes()>; bValue:= <size of data> {byte}; <p/> NODE_START:= <a href="../../../com/day/durbo/DurboConstants.html#NODE_START"><code>DurboConstants.NODE_START</code></a>; NODE_END:= <a href="../../../com/day/durbo/DurboConstants.html#NODE_END"><code>DurboConstants.NODE_END</code></a>; PROPERTY:= <a href="../../../com/day/durbo/DurboConstants.html#PROPERTY"><code>DurboConstants.PROPERTY</code></a>; MULTIPLE:= <a href="../../../com/day/durbo/DurboConstants.html#MULTIPLE"><code>DurboConstants.MULTIPLE</code></a>; NAMESPACE:= <a href="../../../com/day/durbo/DurboConstants.html#NAMESPACE"><code>DurboConstants.NAMESPACE</code></a>; <p/>

    • Constructor Detail

      • DurboOutput

        public DurboOutput(java.io.OutputStream out)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new DurboOutput that uses the given output stream. this also writes the protocol header.

        please note that the protocol version is set to DurboConstants.PROTOCOL_VERSION_1 which is probably what you want.

        please note that this uses the IdentityNamespaceResolver and can therefor generate weird results upon deserialization.

        Parameters:
        out - the output stream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs

      • DurboOutput

        public DurboOutput(java.io.OutputStream out,
                   double version)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new DurboOutput that uses the given output stream. this also writes the protocol header.

        please note that this uses the IdentityNamespaceResolver and can therefor generate weird results upon deserialization.

        Parameters:
        out - the output stream
        version - the protocol version to use. default is DurboConstants.PROTOCOL_VERSION
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs

      • DurboOutput

        public DurboOutput(java.io.OutputStream out,
                   DurboNamespaceResolver resolver,
                   java.lang.String contentType,
                   boolean compressed)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new DurboOutput that uses the given output stream. this also writes the protocol header.
        Parameters:
        out - the output stream
        resolver - the namespace resolver
        contentType - the content type to include in the header. default is DurboConstants.DEFAULT_CONTENT_TYPE
        compressed - if true output stream will be compressed.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs

      • writeProperty

        public void writeProperty(java.lang.String name,
                          java.io.InputStream in,
                          int size)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Write a property with the given name and data provided in the input stream to to the output.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the property
        in - the data to write to the stream
        size - The number of bytes to write from the InputStream. If this value is negative, as much is read from the input stream as possible.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs
